title: Grilled Sardines with Tomato–Cucumber Salad
description: Fresh whole sardines are simply seasoned and grilled until the skin is crisp and smoky, served alongside a bright tomato–cucumber salad dressed with lemon, olive oil, and herbs. The dish is light, Mediterranean in profile, and ready in under 30 minutes for a fast, flavorful meal.

ingredients.display_name: whole fresh sardines, gutted and scaled
ingredients.notes: approx. 4 sardines per person; 75 g each on average; leave heads on or remove per preference

ingredients.display_name: medium tomatoes, diced (preferably roma or vine)

ingredients.notes: soak briefly in cold water to mellow if desired
optional but recommended for briny contrast
adds smoky depth if not using a charcoal grill

steps.text: Prepare the sardines: rinse and pat dry with paper towels, remove any remaining scales, and season both inside and out with half the salt and half the pepper; lightly brush with a portion of the olive oil.

Make the salad: in a bowl combine diced tomatoes, diced cucumber, sliced red onion, minced garlic, capers (if using) and chopped parsley. Add lemon juice, remaining olive oil, remaining salt and pepper, and toss gently to combine. Taste and adjust seasoning.
Preheat the grill or grill pan to high heat until very hot and lightly oiled. If using stovetop grill pan, heat over medium-high until smoking hot; if outdoor grill, achieve medium-high direct heat.

Grill the sardines: place sardines skin-side down on the hot grill or pan, cook without moving for 2–3 minutes until skin is crisp and releases easily. Flip carefully and cook 1–2 minutes more until flesh is opaque and firm but not overcooked.
Finish and serve: transfer sardines to a platter, sprinkle with smoked paprika if using and scatter extra parsley. Serve immediately with the tomato–cucumber salad and lemon wedges alongside.
